page.title: 13Grays School Of Art
page.content: Grays School Of Art was built in 1967.It began as a mechanic institute which was foynded in 1824. The old school was siuated at Schoolhill.After 10 years it was given to Robert Gordon's Institute of Technology.Then it was owned by a man called Mr. John Gray.Mr Gray supplied all the money for the school.Apart from drawing the school does pottery,printing and design.They also have shows and shops. Gray school of arts is sloping south to the river Dee.Besides the school there are two other colleges, Scotts Sutherland and the college for quantity surveyers. Population of students 250 Architecture, 200 Art 150 Surveying.
